Articles.Content: It would be awesome if there was something that would make a .craft file into a .gcode or other kind of file so that we could 3d print the crafts we design, like a pretty nice lander that you made in career mode that you want on your desk. it would be nice if there was something that could do that, and if there is, then please tell me.
Eucl3d used to offer up such a service before they closed up shop. Haven't heard of any place or way since

I'm pretty sure there's a way to export the .mu files that KSP uses (at least I thin KEP uses .mu files) into blender, and then 3D print it from there. Not sure on the particulars though.

So yes, there's a way.

There used to be a section of the store which linked to a website which did pretty much exactly what you described, but it stopped awhile back, I dont think they were making a profit. so its definitley possible, and has been done before.
I saw something pass by on Reddit a few days ago, might help you
We had a pretty extensive thread on this down in the off topic section a few weeks ago.  Try looking there.
